intro: Eschweilera chaffanjonii, commonly known as the Chaffanjon’s sycamore, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lecythidaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of South America, particularly in regions of Ecuador and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and produces showy, red or orange flowers that attract various pollinators. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in forest ecosystems. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and is of interest for conservation efforts.
